Posts.EditableText: I'm already downloaded the .quest file, but the game was writen in english. How can i translate the whole game into another language? or how can i run it on my broswer so i can use the translater?
Posts.HTML: I'm already downloaded the .quest file, but the game was writen in english. How can i translate the whole game into another language? or how can i run it on my broswer so i can use the translater?

Posts.EditableText:
Translating games is usually pretty difficult unless they were designed for it, because the strings within the game might not be in complete sentences. If you're running the game in a web browser (playing online), some browser extensions may be able to translate it; but some might not work so well with JS-heavy pages.

The last time I tried to play a Quest game in another language, I used the Google Translate app on my phone. Its camera mode will let you point the camera at your computer screen and show a live translation of whatever words are there, and running it on a separate device means there can't be any compatibility issues between the game and the translator.
(this also works for online fiction sites like Wattpad, whose copy-protection occasionally causes problems for Google Translate. Pointing my phone's translator at the screen works fine)
